result.markdown:
--- title: "The year in *content*: 2024" subtitle: "Music, books, and movies" author: "Juan Tellez" date: "2023-12-31" toc: true --- # Intro Here's all the content I consumed this year. The music data comes from Apple Music, the books from Goodreads, and the movies from Letterboxd. The code I used to clean up the Apple Music data is slightly adapted from Andrew Heiss, which is slightly adapted from somewhere else. ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true" code-summary="Show code"} read_itunes_library <- function(path) { raw <- xml2::read_xml(path) res <- xml2::as_list(raw) res <- purrr::pluck(res, "plist", "dict", "dict") res <- res[names(res) != "key"] res <- tibble::enframe(res) %>% dplyr::rowwise() %>% dplyr::mutate(value = list(tibble::enframe(value))) %>% dplyr::ungroup() %>% dplyr::mutate(id = dplyr::row_number()) %>% dplyr::select(-name) %>% tidyr::unnest(value) %>% dplyr::mutate( entry_id = (dplyr::row_number() + (dplyr::row_number() %% 2)) / 2 ) %>% dplyr::rowwise() %>% dplyr::mutate( value = dplyr::if_else(length(value) == 0L, list(list(NA)), list(value)), value = unlist(value) ) %>% dplyr::ungroup() %>% tidyr::pivot_wider( id_cols = c(id, entry_id), names_from = name, values_from = value, values_fn = list ) %>% tidyr::pivot_longer( cols = 4:ncol(.), names_to = "type", values_drop_na = TRUE ) %>% dplyr::select(-type) %>% tidyr::pivot_wider(id_cols = id, names_from = key, values_from = value) %>% janitor::clean_names() %>% dplyr::select( id, track_title = name, artist, album_artist, album, genre, total_time, date_added, skip_count, play_count, year ) %>% dplyr::rowwise() %>% dplyr::mutate(dplyr::across( everything(), ~dplyr::if_else(is.null(.x), list(NA), list(.x)) )) %>% dplyr::mutate(dplyr::across(everything(), unlist)) %>% dplyr::mutate( date_added = strsplit(date_added, "T"), date_added = date_added[1], date_added = lubridate::ymd(date_added), skip_count = as.numeric(skip_count), play_count = as.numeric(play_count), total_time = as.numeric(total_time), year = as.numeric(year) ) %>% dplyr::ungroup() %>% dplyr::arrange(dplyr::desc(play_count)) res } ``` ::: # Music ## New albums in my library First, the **albums I added to my Apple Music library this year**. These are the records I discovered this year, whether they came out this year or earlier. Below are the top five by play count^[One limitation is that, all else equal, albums with more songs will have higher play counts.]. ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Top albums added to my Apple Music library in 2024
Artist Album
Adrianne Lenker Bright Future
Karen Dalton It's So Hard to Tell Who's Going to Love You the Best
Nap Eyes The Neon Gate
Waxahatchee Tigers Blood
Okonski Magnolia
````` ::: ::: - *Adrianne Lenker* is always good, respect for musicians who put out a lot of music. Some great tracks on this one, and I love the versions on the live album. - *Karen Dalton*, new discovery for me. Odd voice, and I love the bass on some of these songs. - The *Nap Eyes* record is great. They came to that vineyard near here but I couldn't go see them. ## Favorite records of the year These are the records that *came out this year* and that I *added to my library this year*. ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Favorite albums of 2024
Artist Album Genre
John Cale Paris 1919 (Deluxe Edition) Alternative
Okonski Magnolia Jazz
Christopher Owens I Wanna Run Barefoot Through Your Hair Alternative
````` ::: ::: **For my favorites that came out this year**, I'll pick: - This great, piano-forward jazz record by *Okonski*. - The new *Christopher Owens* solo record. Listened to Girls for years, and this one still surprised me. - *Paris 1919* did not come out this year, obviously, but this deluxe edition did, which gives me an excuse to list one of my favorite records of all time. Cale is a genius, has such a sweet perspective, great Welsh accent. # Books ## Books I read this year Here's the books I finished reading this year and my rating: ::: {.cell layout-align="center"}
  • Nights at the Circus by Angela Carter
    My Rating: ★★★
    Date Read: December 19, 2024
  • Collapse: The Fall of the Soviet Union by Vladislav M. Zubok
    My Rating: ★★★★
    Date Read: December 03, 2024
  • Little Labors by Rivka Galchen
    My Rating: ★★★
    Date Read: October 31, 2024
  • Temporada de huracanes by Fernanda Melchor
    My Rating: ★★★★★
    Date Read: October 27, 2024
  • Lituma en los Andes by Mario Vargas Llosa
    My Rating: ★★★★★
    Date Read: October 02, 2024
  • My Year of Rest and Relaxation by Ottessa Moshfegh
    My Rating: ★★★★★
    Date Read: September 14, 2024
  • A Stranger in Your Own City: Travels in the Middle East's Long War by Ghaith Abdul-Ahad
    My Rating: ★★★★★
    Date Read: September 07, 2024
  • Nonstate Warfare: The Military Methods of Guerillas, Warlords, and Militias by Stephen D. Biddle
    My Rating: ★★★
    Date Read: September 05, 2024
  • Braiding Sweetgrass: Indigenous Wisdom, Scientific Knowledge, and the Teachings of Plants by Robin Wall Kimmerer
    My Rating: ★
    Date Read: August 30, 2024
  • Slouching Towards Utopia: An Economic History of the Twentieth Century by J. Bradford DeLong
    My Rating: ★★★
    Date Read: August 26, 2024
  • Red Mars (Mars Trilogy, #1) by Kim Stanley Robinson
    My Rating: ★★★★
    Date Read: August 12, 2024
  • The Blood of Guatemala: A History of Race and Nation (Latin America Otherwise) by Greg Grandin
    My Rating: ★★
    Date Read: June 29, 2024
  • States and Power in Africa: Comparative Lessons in Authority and Control by Jeffrey Herbst
    My Rating: ★★★★★
    Date Read: June 04, 2024
  • The People Immortal by Vasily Grossman
    My Rating: ★★★
    Date Read: May 17, 2024
  • Una historia política de Colombia: Del siglo XIX al Frente Nacional (Spanish Edition) by Álvaro Tirado Mejía
    My Rating: ★
    Date Read: May 05, 2024
  • The Complete Maus by Art Spiegelman
    My Rating: ★★★★★
    Date Read: April 13, 2024
  • The Right to Sex: Feminism in the Twenty-First Century by Amia Srinivasan
    My Rating: ★★
    Date Read: April 05, 2024
  • Ubik by Philip K. Dick
    My Rating: ★★★
    Date Read: April 02, 2024
  • 2666 by Roberto Bolaño
    My Rating: ★★★★★
    Date Read: March 17, 2024
  • Time Shelter by Georgi Gospodinov
    My Rating: ★★★
    Date Read: March 04, 2024
  • Mutual Aid: A Factor of Evolution by Pyotr Kropotkin
    My Rating: ★★★★
    Date Read: February 29, 2024
  • Return of a King: The Battle for Afghanistan by William Dalrymple
    My Rating: ★★★★
    Date Read: January 30, 2024
::: ## Descriptives How do my ratings compare versus the averages reported by Goodreads? ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](content_2024_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){fig-align='center' width=85%} ::: ::: How long am I spending on each book? Caveat: the dates added / read are approximations in some cases. ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](content_2024_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){fig-align='center' width=85%} ::: ::: ## Favorite books **Favorite books** I read this year: - *Lituma en los Andes*. A sorta police procedural / mystery novel set in the Peruvian highlands during the time of Shining Path. Incredible atmosphere and treatment of SP as a kind of ghost haunting this town. - I can't believe I read *Temporada de huracanes* and *2666* in the same year. Both incredible. Bolaño just an unbelievable writer, he can do anything. And *Huracanes* gives us something new: a "Gummo"-like view of a rural Mexican town where deindustrialization has hollowed out the community. **Surprise read**: *My Year of Rest and Relaxation*. The gender-flipped version of American Psycho. I'm a big Ottessa Moshfegh fan now. **Worst book**: *Una historia política de Colombia*. Repetitive, not much new to say. # Movies You can see all the movies I watched this year at the bottom. Here's my stats for the year: ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
My movie watching stats for 2024
Statistic Value
Number of movies watched 67
Average rating 3.2
Highest rated movie The Curse
Lowest rated movie Anyone But You
Cor(rating, release date) -0.23
````` ::: ::: Here's when I watched: ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](content_2024_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){fig-align='center' width=85%} ::: ::: And here's the distribution of ratings, for fun: ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](content_2024_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){fig-align='center' width=85%} ::: ::: ## Favorite movies **The two best movies I saw this year** were: - *Red Rooms*. One of those movies that is completely engrossing and then you take a beat and realize you've just been watching a few actors, some shots in a courtroom, an apartment, etc. No bells and whistles, just great writing and pacing. - *Possession*. Had heard all the lore and finally watched it at *Dreamland Cinema*. The worst couple of all time. **The worst movie I saw this year** was *Civil War*. Really it should be *Anyone But You* but that movie isn't putting on airs. I thought *Civil War* was totally undermined by its focus on small potatoes photo-journalism. Who cares? **The best movie that came out this year** was *Daughters*, the documentary about a prison program that connects inmates with their daughters for a father-daughter dance. Ugly cry kind of film. ## Full list of movies ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
